    • Vignette Title

Add multiple columns to a data frame

add_cols.Rd

Similar to bind, but allows you to specify the position to insert the columns.

add_cols(x, y, where = 1)

Arguments

x

A data frame.
y

Columns to insert into x.
where

Position to insert. Use 1 to insert on LHS, or -1 to insert on RHS.

See also

[add_col()]

Examples

df <- data.frame(x = 1:5)
add_col(df, "y", runif(5))
#> Error in `[.default`(x, lhs): only 0's may be mixed with negative subscripts
add_col(df, "y", runif(5), where = 1)
#>            y x
#> 1 0.19566983 1
#> 2 0.40353812 2
#> 3 0.06366146 3
#> 4 0.38870131 4
#> 5 0.97554784 5

add_col(df, "x", 5:1)
#>   x
#> 1 5
#> 2 4
#> 3 3
#> 4 2
#> 5 1
